DataElement.preferredName: Measurement Not Entered Reason Disease Status Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Character code to identify the reason a disease measurement was not recorded. [Manually-entered]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Entered; having made a record of; set down in permanent form._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Entered; having made a record of; set down in permanent form.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Having made a record of, set down in permanent form, or formally registered to participate in an activity.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The identification of a tumor that is present at baseline and will not be quantifiably measured over the course of the study.

Concepts.definition: The identification of a tumor that is present at baseline and will not be quantifiably measured over the course of the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

Concepts.definition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Surgery (Immunotherapy) legacy data migration
